intro: Elatostema pseudonasutum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false shamrock, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. Elatostema pseudonasutum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
